actions.recommendation: -Visit a general practitioner or a gynaecologist for a Pap smear and a Radiologist for a mammogram.
-A mammogram is recommended to screen for breast cancer.
-Limit alcohol consumption to 1-2 units or less.
-Moderate exercise will help maintain your BMI and improve your risk of developing lifestyle diseases.
-Make changes to your diet and lifestyle to help stabilise your insulin levels, lower cholesterol and decrease your overall risk of developing chronic illnesses.
-Continue eating a variety of fresh fruit and veggies daily.
Collagen , Zinc , Vitamin D , Vitamin B co
-Your BMI is slightly elevated. Aim to keep it below 25. Aim for a weight to height circumference below 50%. This decreases the risk of developing chronic diseases such as diabetes and hypertension.
